content:
python

np.setAttrib(AuxBitplaneAttrib.make(bits))

cpp

np.set_attrib(AuxBitplaneAttrib::make(bits));

Where bits is a set of bits indicating what should be written into the auxiliary bitplanes.

Although the framebuffer's alpha channel is not technically an auxiliary bitplane, it can be thought of as such, since it is not generally used to store any data of value, since alpha blending has already occurred before the values are written to the framebuffer.

When the shader generator is not enabled, this attrib has no effect.

Values That Can be Requested

The following is a list of bits that can be passed to .AuxBitplaneAttrib.make():
